summary: Thus far, we've discussed both population dynamics and community interactions, briefly touching on how energy flows between these groups. Topic 8.6 expands the scope to ecosystems, explaining the importance of biodiversity to a resilient ecosystem

vocab.definition: The variety of life on Earth at all its levels, encompassing the diversity within species, between species, and across ecosystems, as well as the interactions among them
An organism that is highly abundant or has the greatest biomass within a particular ecological community, and whose presence disproportionately influences the community
An organism that plays a disproportionately large and critical role in maintaining the structure and health of its ecosystem relative to its abundance
